page.title: 06Luddington School
page.content: Luddington primary school was opened in 1975 and replaced the two schools at Luddington and Garthorpe as a result of falling rolls. The number on roll at its opening was 71 the present number of pupils is 51. There are 3 members of staff including the headmistress. A nursery class is held 2 half days a week. These 51 children come from 39 families. As part of the work done for the project a survey was made of various modern items of equipment possessed by each family. All the families have a cooker, washer, radio and television. 38 families have a refrigerator, 31 have a freezer, 29 have a telephone, 18 have a video recorder, 7 have a computer, 10 have a microwave oven, 28 have a music centre and 33 have a car.
